name: lib/actions.js
configureAction
description: Configures a Flux Standard Action creator injected with dispatch, getState and the libraries context.
examples:
<caption>Exports a Flux Standard Action creator that takes a handler injected with dispatch, getState, and the libraries context.
export const createSomeUserAction = configureDispatcherAction((dispatch, getState, context) => dispatcher.action.execute('create-some-user-action'))

name: configureActionDispatcher
description: Configures a Flux Standard Action creator injected with the libraries dispatcher and context.
examples:
<caption>Exports a Flux Standard Action creator that takes a handler injected with the libraries dispatcher and context.
export const createSomeUserAction = configureDispatcherAction((dispatcher, context) => dispatcher.action.execute('create-some-user-action'))

name: actionDefinition
description: Allows the user of lib to define custom redux actions that will be injected with libraries context when action is dispatched

LIB_NAME
description: Lib Constants

name: ACTION_PREFIX
description: Redux Action Type Constants

name: lib/context.js

properties.name: actionNames
properties.description: the names of the defined actions (ordered).

properties.name: actionNames
properties.description: the names of all the actions (ordered).

description: Validates library creators options

name: validateAppOpts
description: Validates library consumers options

lib/dispatcher.js
lib/index.js
lib/log.js
lib/middleware.js
lib/reducer.js
createReducer
description: When context has already been created, it can be shared to middleware component.

name: configureReducer
description: Creates reducer from opts including validation in development

name: lib/store.js
toConstCase
description: Formats a string as CONST_CASE

name: createNoopStore
description: Creates a store with all functions returning noop

return.description: Noop store object with noop dispatch, getState, subscribe, and replaceReducer functions.

name: configureBrowserStateAccessor
description: Configures an accessor object with getState and setState functions for interacting with browser storage.

params.name: browserStorage
params.description: The storage medium to use (sessionStorage / localStorage).

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: The prefix to use for state keys.

params.name: options.useJSON
params.description: Enables serializing to a single JSON string and uses a single storage key.

params.name: options.formatKey
params.description: The formatter to use for storage keys.

return.description: Thunk taking initialState and returning initialized getState and setState functions.

name: assertBrowserStore
description: Asserts that createBrowserStore options are valid.

name: configureBrowserStore
description: Works the same as createStore but uses browserStorage as persistence medium.

params.name: localReducer
params.description: The reducer to create new state to be persisted.

params.name: initialState
params.description: Initial state to create in local storage (REQUIRED).

params.name: prefix
params.description: The local storage namespace to use.

return.description: Local store object with dispatch, getState, subscribe, and replaceReducer functions.

name: configureSessionStore
description: Configures a createSessionStore thunk that returns the same interface as redux createStore

name: configureLocalStore
description: Configures a createLocalStore thunk that returns the same interface as redux createStore

name: createSessionStore
description:
Creates sessionStorage interfacing component that implements redux store interface.
Uses one sessionStorage key per state node. Only supports primitive state keys.

name: createJSONSessionStore
description:
Creates sessionStorage interfacing component that implements redux store interface.
Serializes / Deserializes state object to and from JSON. Supports nested structures.

name: createLocalStore
description:
Creates localStorage interfacing component that implements redux store interface.
Uses one localStorage key per state node. Only supports primitive state keys.

name: createJSONLocalStore
description:
Creates localStorage interfacing component that implements redux store interface.
Serializes / Deserializes state object to and from JSON. Supports nested structures.

name: configureReducer
description: Configures a reducer that reduces action to a state, then optionally merges with previous state for subscribed action types.

params.name: actionReducer
params.description: Map the action to the object that will be merged to state.

params.name: mergeState
params.description: Defines whether the reducer results should be merged with the previous state.

name: createMergingReducer
description: Creates a reducer that merged payload with state for matching subscribe types.

params.name: subscribeTypes
params.description: Action types to subscribe reducer to.

name: bisectStore
description:
Returns object implementing redux store interface whose getState method selects a sub tree of the overall state.
Useful for library components that embed state in a subnode of consumer apps redux state

params.name: selectKeys
params.description: The selection path to use with getState

return.description: A sub store implementing redux store interface

name: selectState
description: Selects a sub state from a state tree by path.

name: createStoreMultiplexer
description:
createStoreMultiplexer([['lib', libStore], ['fast', fastStore], ['session', sessionStore], ['local', localStore]])
Takes in an ordered mapping of names to stores and reduces to a redux store compatible interface that can dispatch and getState to all stores or specific ones.

params.name: storeMapping
params.description: The mapping of store names to store references.

return.description: An object that can dispatch and getState to all stores or each individually.

name: lib/validate.js
content:
import { assert } from 'chai'

export const validateOpts = opts => {
  const { actions, activeEvents, useFastStore, useLocalStore, thresholds } = opts
  assert.ok(actions, 'actions must exist')
  assert(Array.isArray(actions), 'actions must be an array')
  assert(actions.every(x => Array.isArray(x)), 'actions must be an array of an array')
  assert(actions.every(x => x.length === 2), 'every actions must have length 2')
  assert(actions.every(x => typeof x[0] === 'string'), 'every action must have first ordinal type string event name')
  assert(actions.every(x => typeof x[1] === 'object'), 'every action must have second ordinal type object')
  assert(actions.every(x => typeof x[1].action !== 'undefined'), 'every action must have second ordinal action function defined')
  assert(actions.every(x => {
    const type = typeof x[1].timeoutMS
    return type === 'number' || type === 'function'
  }), 'every action must have second ordinal timeoutMS number or function defined')
  assert.ok(activeEvents, 'active events must exist')
}
